Name: Issue 304
Introduction: Sorry to have another late edition. My only excuse is that I've started blogging again. ;-) So this is a massive issue full of great content, hopefully enough to get you through the week ahead.

Articles.Title: Marvel Heroes Design
Articles.Description: For those of you into UI Design implementations, check out this nice Marvel Super Hero design in Xamarin.Forms

Articles.Title: How to Design a Great App Icon: What You Need to Know
Articles.Description: Learn how to create the perfect app icon, from design considerations to the tools you need, to the building process.

Articles.Title: Xamarin Tools to use in 2021
Articles.Description: Choosing the right tools and resources can make all the difference in being a productive and effective developer. So, what are all the tools and libraries you should be using to build your Xamarin apps in 2021?
Articles.Author: Kym Phillpotts

Articles.Title: Universal AppLinks on iOS
Articles.Description: I was lucky to be tasked to get Universal AppLinks working, for a cool feature in the TrackMan Golf App I work on at work. I thought this would be super easy to do. But, oh how naive and wrong I was.

Articles.Title: How to fix: Visual Studio for Mac: No SDK found at specified location?
Articles.Description: If you have seen the error on your Mac which says: "No SDK found at specified location" you might want to try these suggestions.

Articles.Title: Understanding iOS Image Assets
Articles.Description: When developing apps you'll come to the point where you'll need to deal with image assets. No matter how crudiest the UI could be, you'll probably need some icons or small image resources to compose your layouts. In this post we'll explore how image assets works on iOS.

Articles.Description: Executing ViewModel methods from Xamarin Forms Pages is easy, but how can Page methods be called inside ViewModels?

Articles.Title: Replicating a Facebook Like UI in Xamarin
Articles.Description: In this blog post, we'll be replicating a Facebook UI in Xamarin.Forms. The Facebook app contains some basic modules like a login page, timeline/wall page, profile page, and some other pages for modifying the settings and creating commercial pages.

Articles.Description: Xamarin.Forms now has the DragGestureRecognizer and DropGestureRecognizer, enabling you to implement drag and drop in your apps! In this video we will see how to get started with adding drag and drop to your app and enriching the data that you're transporting.

Articles.Description: This video will show you can use Font Awesome to create vector icons in your Xamarin.Forms app.

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms Shell Login Page Flow
Articles.Description: We are back to Xamarin.Forms navigation with Shell. This time taking your request directly to do a login flow with URL based navigation. We start off login in users and then popping them into the main app and allowing them to log out. With Xamarin.Forms Shell it can be easily accomplished.

Articles.Title: Video in Your Xamarin.Forms App with MediaElement
Articles.Description: Audio and video are big parts of apps nowadays. If you need to add those in your Xamarin.Forms app, you can do so with the MediaElement. MediaElement is a part of the Xamarin Community Toolkit and allows you to play media from remote URLs to embedded sources and anything in between.

Articles.Description: Authenticating a user is often more than meets the user's eye. In this episode, we discuss the challenges, options and our experiences with said topic. We dive into some OAuth, do our best to pronounce Auth0 and discover the passcode to Geralds top-secret studio vault.
